statement.tex: \\ \text{Given }x\neq n\pi, \frac{d}{dx}f(x)\text{ will evaluate}\\ \text{to the following. }\textbf{Right or wrong? }

reason.tex: \text{If f(x) is not defined at a point, then}\\ \text{how can it have a rate of change at that}\\ \text{point? Which is why }x\neq n\pi\text{ is important.} \\ \text{At }x=\pi,2\pi,3\pi\ldots, \sin x = 0.\\ \text{Which means, }f(x)=\dfrac{e^x}{\sin x}\text{ is not defined}\\ \text{there. And therefore, neither is }f'(x).

options.tex: \dfrac{e^x\cdot(\sin x-\cos x)}{\sin^2 x}, x\neq n\pi, n\in\mathbb{Z}
